title: Qantas completes 19-hour test flight from New York to Sydney
text:
The Australian airline Qantas completed a more than 19-hour test flight from New York to Sydney, the first non-stop commercial flight between the destinations.

The flight, which landed in Sydney on Sunday morning, was in part a test to see how the length of the flight affected crew member fatigue and passenger jet lag, The Associated Press reported . The Boeing 787 Dreamliner's journey with 49 passengers marks the world's longest flight at 19 hours and 16 minutes.

ADVERTISEMENT

“Overall, we’re really happy with how the flight went and it’s great to have some of the data we need to help assess turning this into a regular service,” Capt. Sean Golding, who guided the pilots, told the AP.
